Posts.Content: Great news. I had grade 3 invasive Ductal cancer tumour lumpectomy on 29th November along with all the lymph nodes under my left arm removed ( axillary node clearance).  Got esults on Monday 19mm with clear margins and onlybone lymph node affexted. See radiologist on Monday and surgeon has recommended  6 sessions of chemo every 3 weeks and then 3vweeks of radiotheraphy and then anti oestrogen tablets for the next ten years.  Trying to eat more greens to get my alkali levels up and less sugar. Drinking wheatgrass water and trying to do more exercise and have less stress! All the best with your treatment. DL
Posts.Title: Today’s Results from my lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Newbie, I just had the lump and lymph nodes removed and now start the Fec chemo and the Tacotere chemo plus radiotheraphy in January which will take 21 weeks and have cried each time meet consultant  breast nurse and oncologist.  Was all clear last year so where did this come from....too much stress this year, too much oestrogen now so will be on anti oestrogen tablets for next ten years.  Need to get more greens in diet and up my healthy eating and exercise.  Keep in toich newbie. Mine was grade 3 invasive Ductal cancer  19 mms with one node affexted.. xo
Posts.Title: New to site and recently diagnosed

Posts.Content: Had lumpectomy and axillary node clearance on 29th November so over the 3 week period. Have one cording or axilarry web syndrome. Chemo to start 16th January.. .6 sessions 3 of SRC and 3 of Tacotere.   Any suggestions for the one cord? DL
Posts.Title: Axillary Node Clearence

Posts.Content: Thanks Kasang, Doing exercises and have physio appointment for 3rd January.  Out walking in Northern Ireland and it has been 4 weeks niw. Hoping to play a hockey match before chemo as I was top goal scorer at end of November.  Having read conversations on here a lot of peeps were given choices for axillary node clearance but they just cleared mine as they thoight there were at least 2 affected.  Results...only one node affected out of 9.  I havent been told about percentages regarding chemo???? Maybe becuase the ductal cnacer was stage 3 invasive I am just being given cheno but have a pre assessment for the 6 sessions ( every 3 weeks for the next 4 months) on 9th January. What do I ask regarding percentages???? Will be taking anti oestrogen tablets for the next ten years  and possible herceptin injections ( one every 3 weeks) for one year..  Also my brother tells me more organics more greens less sugar and less stress at work can all help too.  Hapy New Year DL aged 51.
Posts.Title: Axillary Node Clearence

Posts.Content: Hi Taralou, I had clearance 4 weeks ago and once drain came out swelling was the size of a banana and 4 weeks later it is down to a gurkin. Do your exercises and if you can go for little walks. DL
Posts.Title: Axillary Node Clearence

Posts.Content: Hi. The drain is sore but do your exercises. When drain comes out the swelling like a banana starts under the arm bit 2 weeks later it starts to subside. Lots of ladies have this done so we have to look after that arm for the rest of our lives  3 weeks after op and under arm is nu.be and sensitive and I am now at GP as I have some cording.  All the best DL
Posts.Title: Axillary Node Clearence

Posts.Content: Dear Sarah, I had only one lymph node affected and the norm in Norhern Ireland is to remove all.  I have read research into this as well and it seems to be best practice over here.  I had level 3 invasive ductal rumour.  DL
Posts.Title: Axillary Node Clearence

Posts.Content: Thank you Kasang.  I have a pre assessment on 9th Jan and my first chemo FEC on 16th but I never discussed HER2 -+ but will ask this. I will also ask about Herceptin results as I am still awaiting this. As one of the lymph nodes was affected the chemotherapy is an automatic recommendation along with grade 3 invasive Ductal 19 mm tumour in Northern Ireland.  Lump under arm is going down now that I am in my 4th week and seeing physio next week to check on one cord.  Back to exercises. XO DL
Posts.Title: Axillary Node Clearence

Posts.Content: Good to know Lynn. They did my axillary clearance on 29th November along with lumpectomy. One node was affected. I was all.clear last year...16th May 2016 for first mammogram so I wonder how fast a grade 3 one grows. Oh well. Off to gym as I have gone to a few classes this week and out walking if not too icy .scared for Tuesday but will pray all goes smoothly. Keep in touch. Xo DL
Posts.Title: Neo adjuvant chemotherapy, midway scan

Posts.Content: Hi Lily Rose. I also had 19 MM IDC  with one node affected grade 3 and start Fec t on Tuesday 23rd for the first time. No cold cap offered in Northern Irelnad and they are going to try 2 veins near wrist first. If that doesnt work then the PICC line will go in. I am having physio as I have one cord under arm which is pulling. I am 51 by the way. Have been walking after op and juat went to gym a couple of times this week plus played a game of field hockey. Wish I was at cycle six. DL. Ps. Gave 14 inches of my hair to the Little Princess Trust so have a bit of a Pixie cut at present. XO
Posts.Title: Neo adjuvant chemotherapy, midway scan

Posts.Content: Thanks Jammy R, Any suggestions for hard veins ( no pocc line)? One week to go until chemo 6 and veins are like hosepipes! Beetroot juice? Rub in coconut oil into lower arm?
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Karebear, You have been so helpful along the way. Had my 6th and last chemo on Tuesday and Neulasta injection on Wed so side effects starting. Been to city for radio planning meeting so start in 3 weeks along with anti oestrogen meds for the next  five years....Anastrozole  or something?  Will just drive up from Banbridge.  Have first herceptin Injection in Dundonald on 3rd July and then every 3 weeks until July 2019. Take care up there in the big smoke! XO DL
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Dear May Chemo group, Chemo 5 of Docetaxal Tacotere over and got a reduction of 20% due to blisters after really hot feet at chemo 4 plus side effects of Neulasta sore bones and white furry tongue, T trots etc for 2 weeks ( glad I read about T truck hitting you).  Veins are like hosepipes according to nurse so had to run arm under hot water for 5 minutes to get in.  A week later after chemo 5 I had lower sore arm around veins and had to get IV antibiotic plus on a week of antibiotics.  Also had a bit of peripheral neuropathy so taking Loratadene which is like clarityn to help tingling in fingers and nails.  One more to go in Tuesday 15th May and then up to Belfast  for 3 weeks of radiotherapy. After that a year of herceptin injections plus 5 to 10 years of anti oestrogen meds. It's a long journey.  D L 51 ( Northern Ireland)
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi LaLa 1982, Once you get the Neulasta white blood cell Injection do not do too much as it will hurt more.  Take paracetamol and cocodamol for the pain and I tried tonic water (quinine).   My last chemo 6 is tomorrow and veins are like hosepipes so hope they get in.  3 weeks of radiotherapy plus a year of herceptin injections every 3 weeks plus anti oestrogen meds for the next 5 to ten years . I don't do things by half.  Xo DL 51 from Northern Ireland.
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Georgie18, try a satin/silk pillow case if your scalp is annoying you. I gave all 14 inches to the Little Princess trust, went pixie cut and after the 6 week I could not go put without one of the Clara Priestly chemo hats/scarves  got a lovely grey head snood from Line and Current and it has been what I wear every day. I let the hairs fall out and you are right I was sweeping up for weeks and now have the baby fluff  on a white scull I must have been born with. If you can get out and walk on your good days and drink plenty to flush it through. They say cold caps do have have a great success anyway. XO DL
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thank you Linda.  Really hope they reduce the Final 2 doses a wee bit as sore heels make it difficult for walking and sore  sensitive nails hurt if I hit  off anything. Mouth is clearing a bit but 7 days later seems forever. Xo DL
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thanks Aspen
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Dear Dormouse, I had 3 FEC and then had  my first Tacotere/docetaxal.  I had sore limbs - hips knees shins feet, hot heels with 2 blisters, sore fingers and nails, sore throat with white tongue, toilet issues and all because of the T! I spent the past 2 weeks in the house/bed as feet were too sore to walk. Made it to hospital for meds for tongue and toilet issues.  Two weeks later feet are still sore with 2 blisters.  Rang the hotline and they said they can reduce the T 5 and T6 by 20% but wondering if they might move me back to FEC although veins are like hosepipes.   For the pain I was told to take paracetamol/cocodamol/ibubrufen. 2 cycles to go. DL
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi All, Had my Taxotere drip cycle 1 on Tuesday past followed by the white blood cell Injection of Neulasta the following day. Have had to take paracetamol/cocodamol for the bone/joint pain for the past 6 days.  Tongue is white and furry with sore throat so saw gp for oral thrush cream and mentioned the diarrhea/itching so was given cream and tablet for that. Nails and soles of feet are sore too.  My aunt mentioned pineapple juice to help with furry tongue? Also tonic water may help due to quinine with bone soreness. Anyone else have any tips? Is it better to keep legs/feet cold or warm? DL.  Ps have 2 more Taxotere/Docetaxal to go at end of April and then in May.
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Skifan, They gave me Datarin for the tongue which has helped and they had given me Biotenr for my mouth anyway. Datarkin is now working. The sore ends of fingers/nails and heels....I rang the Chemo unit and they have noted this and I have asked for a reduction of 20% for my last 2 Tacotere/Docetaxal as lying around for almost 9 days was not on!  I had not heard of cold gloves or slippers over here in Northern Ireland but will ask. They don't promote the cold cap either.  I need my veins to be warm and hydrated for the last two so need to get beetroot juice into me and lots of fluids. Ps pineapple is supposed to help with tongue too. Thanks for all the advice. DL
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thanks G 'n J. Just the finger nails a bit sore and sensitive to warm water.  Heels tender.  Will let onco know. Got Daktarin gel for tongue so not looking as white.  This is definitely tougher for me that the FEC. Need to take on more fluids too. There is only so much TV that I can watch so hopefully this week will be better. Thanks for the advice. XO DL
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Karebear.  I am only do the lymphatic massages. What types of exercises do you do please? DL
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***
